content.title: Child on death row in South Sudan as state executions escalate - rights group - CNN
content.desc: State-sanctioned executions are on the rise in South Sudan and people who were children at the time of the crime are among those who have received the death penalty, according to a new report by Amnesty International. content.desc: Children are among those being executed in South Sudan, in an “extremely disturbing” escalation of the state’s use of the death penalty, according to Amnesty International. This year, seven people, including one child, were hanged, the highest number since the county gained independence in 2011 , according to evidence provided to Amnesty by legal professionals and government officials. In 2017, two of the four people executed were children at the time of their conviction, the organisation said.
